_source.complaint_what_happened:
my card has been declined for " suspicious '' purchases and they are not able to prevent, or remedy the problem. I've worked with them multiple times and after excessive hold times on each call, it continues and can't seem to be fixed. 

Each time I call it's a different excuse. 

This started in early XXXX of XXXX and has occurred in XXXX, XXXX, XXXX of XXXX, XXXX of XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

The purchases were for the following : 1. Pizza at local Pizza shop. ( 1 block from house ) 2. XXXX XXXX for prescription medicine and household ( 2 miles from home ) 3. Online game service using a virtual card number that was exclusively provided by capital one for this service.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.sub_issue: Can't use card to make purchases

complaint_what_happened: Pizza at local Pizza shop. ( 1 block from house ) 2. XXXX XXXX for prescription medicine and household ( 2 miles from home ) 3. Online game service using a virtual card number that was exclusively provided by capital one for this service.

_source.complaint_what_happened: The problem has been for almost a year I've been dealing with missing money from my bank.the most recent incident was Saturday XX/XX/XXXX. Pizza was ordered online for XXXX $ somehow the transaction charged twice I contacted the pizza place she said wait until Monday and you'll see the amount only charged once because their receipts showed it going thru only once. So I waited until Monday and the total came out of my account twice ... Now I've been dealing with this problem with this bank for at least a year I called they gave me some excuse so we did the fraud again. 4 months ago the same thing was happening with another organization I was paying for my membership every month and the bank was taking the money twice a month and when I called too get it take care of they denied giving my money back. So this has been going on to long and I need to figure out how to get this taking care of because I don't know what the bank is doing with the extra money that keeps getting charged to my account.they even allowed a organization to take money from a frozen debit card and made the excuse that it was mastercards fault.
_source.issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Can't stop withdrawals from your account

complaint_what_happened: Pizza was ordered online for XXXX $ somehow the transaction charged twice I contacted the pizza place she said wait until Monday and you'll see the amount only charged once because their receipts showed it going thru only once. So I waited until Monday and the total came out of my account twice ...

CHIME. suddenly close my account without any reason, last transaction i made was buying a pizza from XXXX! and i still have about {$25.00} left in my account. 

email attached to the account XXXX XXXX

complaint_what_happened: CHIME. suddenly close my account without any reason, last transaction i made was buying a pizza from XXXX! and i still have about {$25.00} left in my account. email attached to the account XXXX XXXX

_source.product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
_source.complaint_what_happened:
XX/XX/19 - I went to a pizza restaurant called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, located in downtown XXXX, Massachusetts. My total was {$11.00} and I tipped {$1.00} at the cashier. 

XX/XX/19 - After my pizza transaction posted, I noticed that the amount was for {$110000.00}. It appeared that the pizza cashier had fraudulently entered the pre-tip and post-tip transaction amounts as one amount. This was greater than my ~ {$32000.00} credit limit with my XXXX credit card. I called the merchant and they were shocked. They immediately processed a return. I then called XXXX and explained to them what happened. The agent let me know that they could see the return and that it would process soon. 

XX/XX/19 - My billing cycle ended before the return was processed. My outstanding balance totaled XXXX {$110000.00}. This was many times greater than my credit limit, yet XXXX still allowed this transaction to process. 

XX/XX/19 - The return from the merchant was processed. My outstanding balance returned to the appropriate amount. 

XX/XX/19 - I checked my credit score using the XXXX XXXX XXXX app and the XXXX XXXX XXXX tool. Both showed a credit score in the high 500s. This is 200+ points LOWER than my credit score had previously been. I called XXXX to report this and they asked me to call back the following day when the credit specialists would be available to take a call. 

XX/XX/19 - I called back and the credit specialist said that they would send an overnight letter to the credit bureaus detailing my updated outstanding balance. I am not certain that this will " make me whole '' in terms of my credit profile, as there may be historical components to credit score calculations and the erroneous $ XXXX transaction is not being expunged from my record entirely. Instead, XXXX is just updating the current balance.
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.complaint_what_happened: Not only did they fail to file my disputes when I submitted them they have been extremely rude and volatile towards me. I called back to check them and that's when I had to resubmit them and they denied them. These charges were blatantly fraudulent. Ordering pizzas in other states and using XXXX pay to someone I don't know. I've spent hours upon hours on hold and speaking with incompetent employees that all give me different answers. I've escalated these charges 3 or 4 times without any investigator calling me to make a determination. Today I found out they closed my escalations because I have failed to provide any more information regarding these charges. Unbelievable ... .How can a company exist with such unethical practices. Not only exist but represents our government assistance. I've never been treated so terribly by a company that is supposed to represent me and my interests. I was the one stolen from and now they've turned their backs on me without my voice being heard. I don't have the exact information in front of me of the dates and amounts but I know 3 pizza deliveries in other states at the end of XXXX I think, a XXXX pay to someone I don't know, and others which I would be happy to gather the information necessary to complete this.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
_source.sub_issue: Charged for a purchase or transfer you did not make with the card

complaint_what_happened: I don't have the exact information in front of me of the dates and amounts but I know 3 pizza deliveries in other states at the end of XXXX I think, a XXXX pay to someone I don't know, and others which I would be happy to gather the information necessary to complete this.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I reported fraudulent activity on my visa credit card with Bank America. There were two fraudulent charges made on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX at the same location in amount of {$39.00}. I filed a claim with Bank of America and they denied the claim with no explanation other than saying I have too many accounts with this pizza place, which makes no sense. I contacted them again and they said they'd have to file an appeal it would be another 45-90 days. In the meantime while I'm waiting for appeal, they added the two charges back into my account which is continue to accrue interest. Please help me with these fraudulent charges and unfair treatment from Bank of America
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Around XX/XX/2019, I noticed fraudulent orders on my account amounting to $ 77+ in pizza. I called Wells Fargo and was informed they would investigate and order me a new card. The very next day 26+ unauthorized transactions appeared on my account. Alarmed, I informed Wells Fargo again about the egregious acts. They again informed me that they would take care of it. 

Now I can't make sense of what I owe and what was fraud. They use an accounting-esque system that uses debit and credits much like accountants. The adjustments they note don't even list the reasoning for it. This is absurd and until Wells Fargo returns my funds, I will be out {$340.00}. I live and reside in the XXXX/XXXX area. How charges in other states went unnoticed is just absurd. Everyone in compliance should be fired.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
